title: Clean Energy Innovation Act
summary: A bill to promote research and development in clean energy technologies and provide tax incentives for clean energy production.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Clean Energy Innovation Act".

SEC. 2. FINDINGS.
Congress finds that—
(1) accelerating innovation in clean energy technologies will reduce greenhouse gas emissions and strengthen U.S. energy security;
(2) public-private partnerships are essential to leverage expertise and capital across sectors;
(3) targeted tax incentives can lower the cost of deployment and drive market adoption of cutting-edge technologies.

SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS.
In this Act:
(1) ‘‘clean energy technology’’ means any technology that generates energy from renewable sources, improves energy efficiency, or enables carbon capture and storage.
(2) ‘‘Secretary’’ means the Secretary of Energy.

SEC. 4. RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, AND DEMONSTRATION PROGRAM.
(a) Establishment.—The Secretary shall carry out a program of research, development, and demonstration to improve the performance and reduce the cost of clean energy technologies.
(b) Grants.—The Secretary shall award competitive grants to institutions of higher education, national laboratories, and private entities.

SEC. 5. TAX INCENTIVES.
(a) Production Credit.—For electricity produced from qualified clean energy facilities, a production tax credit of up to 3.5 cents per kilowatt-hour.
(b) Investment Credit.—An investment tax credit of 30 percent of the qualified investment in eligible clean energy property.

SEC. 6. REPORT.—Not later than 2 years after enactment, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report on progress made under this Act.

title: National Defense Authorization Act
summary: Annual bill that authorizes funding for the Department of Defense and sets policies for defense programs.
fullText:
SECTION 101. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2026." 

TITLE I—PROCUREMENT
SEC. 1011. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.
Funds are hereby authorized to be appropriated for procurement of advanced weapon systems, including:
    (1) Next-generation fighter aircraft;
    (2) Unmanned aerial and underwater vehicles;
    (3) Missile defense systems.

TITLE II—RESEARCH, DEVELOPMENT, TEST, AND EVALUATION
SEC. 2011. MODERNIZATION AND INNOVATION.
The Secretary of Defense shall expand programs to accelerate development of emerging technologies, including artificial intelligence, hypersonic weapons, and directed energy.

TITLE III—MILITARY PERSONNEL
SEC. 3011. MILITARY PAY AND BENEFITS.
(a) Pay Raise.—Members of the Armed Forces shall receive a 4.0 percent increase in basic pay.
(b) Family Support.—Enhanced family childcare and housing allowances.

TITLE IV—OTHER MATTERS
SEC. 4011. CYBER OPERATIONS.
Establishes a unified command for offensive and defensive cyber operations.

title: Healthcare Affordability Act
summary: Legislation aimed at reducing prescription drug prices and expanding healthcare coverage for low-income Americans.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Healthcare Affordability Act." 

SEC. 2. PRESCRIPTION DRUG PRICE NEGOTIATION.
(a) Authority.—The Secretary of Health and Human Services shall negotiate with manufacturers to lower prices for 50 high-cost prescription drugs.
(b) Out-of-Pocket Cap.—Establishes a $2,000 annual cap on out-of-pocket drug expenses for Medicare beneficiaries.

SEC. 3. EXPANSION OF COVERAGE.
(a) Medicaid Expansion Incentive.—Provides enhanced federal matching funds to States that expand Medicaid eligibility to individuals with incomes up to 150 percent of the Federal Poverty Level.
(b) Subsidy Increase.—Increases Affordable Care Act premium tax credits by 20 percent for individuals earning between 150 and 400 percent of the Federal Poverty Level.

SEC. 4. PRIMARY CARE INVESTMENT.
Authorizes grants to community health centers to expand primary care access in underserved areas.

SEC. 5. REPORT.
Within 18 months, the Secretary shall report on cost savings and coverage improvements achieved.

title: Border Security Enhancement Act
summary: Bill to increase funding for border security measures and streamline immigration processes.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Border Security Enhancement Act." 

SEC. 2. ADDITIONAL FUNDING.
Authorizes $5,000,000,000 for increased personnel, advanced surveillance technology, and physical barriers.

SEC. 3. TECHNOLOGY DEPLOYMENT.
Mandates the installation of drones, sensors, and biometric scanners along high-traffic border sectors.

SEC. 4. IMMIGRATION PROCESSING.
(a) Expansion of Processing Centers.—Funds four additional processing centers near major ports of entry.
(b) Case Management.—Creates an electronic case tracking system to reduce backlog and ensure timely hearings.

SEC. 5. REPORTING.
The Secretary of Homeland Security shall submit quarterly reports on enforcement actions, technology uptime, and processing times.

title: Education Opportunity Expansion Act
summary: Legislation to increase funding for public schools and expand student loan forgiveness programs.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Education Opportunity Expansion Act." 

SEC. 2. K–12 FUNDING.
Increases Title I grants by $10,000,000,000 annually to support low-income school districts for staffing, materials, and infrastructure.

SEC. 3. STUDENT LOAN FORGIVENESS.
(a) Eligibility.—Borrowers who have made 120 qualifying payments under income-driven plans shall receive full loan forgiveness.
(b) Cap.—Forgiveness capped at $50,000 per borrower.

SEC. 4. TEACHER RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION.
Grants for high-need districts to offer signing bonuses and tuition reimbursement for educators in STEM and special education.

SEC. 5. OVERSIGHT.
The Department of Education shall publish annual performance metrics on fund utilization and student outcomes.

title: Tax Simplification Act
summary: Bill to reform the tax code, reduce corporate tax rates, and simplify tax filing for individuals.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Tax Simplification Act." 

SEC. 2. CORPORATE RATE REDUCTION.
Amends Section 11 of the Internal Revenue Code to reduce the corporate tax rate from 21 percent to 18 percent.

SEC. 3. STANDARD DEDUCTION ADJUSTMENT.
Increases the standard deduction to $15,000 for single filers and $30,000 for joint filers.

SEC. 4. FLAT TAX OPTION.
Allows taxpayers with adjusted gross income under $100,000 to elect a flat 10 percent tax on taxable income in lieu of itemized calculations.

SEC. 5. SIMPLIFIED FILING.
Directs the IRS to develop a mobile application and pre-filled return system for eligible taxpayers.

SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE.
The amendments made by this Act shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.

title: Climate Action Now Act
summary: Comprehensive legislation to address climate change through emissions reductions, renewable energy investments, and international cooperation.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Climate Action Now Act." 

SEC. 2. EMISSIONS REDUCTION TARGETS.
(a) National Goal.—Reduce net greenhouse gas emissions by 50 percent below 2005 levels by 2035.
(b) Sectoral Plans.—EPA shall develop and enforce emissions standards for power generation, transportation, and industry.

SEC. 3. RENEWABLE ENERGY INVESTMENTS.
Establishes a Green Bank with $20,000,000,000 in initial capitalization to fund solar, wind, and storage projects.

SEC. 4. REFORESTATION AND CONSERVATION.
Grants to States and private landowners for large-scale reforestation and soil carbon sequestration projects.

SEC. 5. INTERNATIONAL COOPERATION.
Authorizes contributions to global climate funds and mandates U.S. leadership in technology sharing.

SEC. 6. OVERSIGHT AND REPORTING.
Annual report to Congress on progress toward targets and financial expenditures.

title: Small Business Relief Act
summary: Bill to provide tax relief and regulatory flexibility for small businesses recovering from economic challenges.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Small Business Relief Act." 

SEC. 2. EMPLOYEE RETENTION CREDIT EXTENSION.
Extends refundable tax credits equal to 50 percent of qualified wages paid by eligible employers through December 31, 2026.

SEC. 3. LOAN FORGIVENESS SIMPLIFICATION.
Simplifies the forgiveness process for Paycheck Protection Program loans of $150,000 or less by adopting a one-page application.

SEC. 4. REGULATORY RELIEF.
Requires agencies to grant waivers or deferrals of non-safety regulations for small businesses that can demonstrate undue hardship.

SEC. 5. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.
Grants to Small Business Development Centers to expand counseling and workforce training programs.

title: Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act
summary: Bipartisan bill to fund improvements to roads, bridges, public transit, broadband, and other infrastructure.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act." 

SEC. 2. SURFACE TRANSPORTATION.
Provides $110,000,000,000 for highway and bridge construction, repair, and resilience upgrades.

SEC. 3. PUBLIC TRANSIT.
Allocates $39,000,000,000 to modernize bus and rail systems, including zero-emission vehicle procurement.

SEC. 4. BROADBAND EXPANSION.
Authorizes $65,000,000,000 in grants to expand affordable high-speed internet to unserved and underserved areas.

SEC. 5. WATER SYSTEMS.
Funds $55,000,000,000 for drinking water, wastewater, and stormwater infrastructure, prioritizing disadvantaged communities.

SEC. 6. IMPLEMENTATION.
Projects shall comply with Buy America requirements and prevailing wage standards under the Davis–Bacon Act.

title: Veterans Healthcare Improvement Act
summary: Legislation to expand healthcare services for veterans and improve VA hospital facilities.
fullText:
SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE.
This Act may be cited as the "Veterans Healthcare Improvement Act." 

SEC. 2. FACILITY UPGRADES.
Authorizes $8,000,000,000 for renovation and modernization of VA medical centers and clinics.

SEC. 3. TELEHEALTH EXPANSION.
Grants to expand telehealth infrastructure, enabling remote consultations for rural and homebound veterans.

SEC. 4. MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES.
Establishes 200 new Vet Centers and funds additional training for mental health professionals specializing in PTSD and suicide prevention.

SEC. 5. CARE COORDINATION.
Creates a National Veteran Care Coordination Office to streamline referrals between VA and community providers.

SEC. 6. REPORT.
The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall submit an annual report on access metrics, patient satisfaction, and facility improvements.
